info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 6:05PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN RETURNS FOR SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY... A quick moving moisture laden front will sweep across the Gulf of Alaska through Saturday before moving into the area Saturday evening. 1 to 3 inches of rain are expected near sea level out of the front. The larger rain totals of 2 to 3 from Yakutat to just south of Cross Sound along coastal locations, while 1 to 2 inch for the southern panhandle will be the expected amounts. Higher rain amounts are possible on windward slopes of the terrain. Snow levels are expected to rise from 2500 feet to 4000 feet. Increased runoff from rainfall and snowmelt will produce rises along small streams. Some streams may approach bankfull levels but no flooding is expected at this time. In regions with a larger snow pack near sea level, blocked drainages and ditches may lead to ponding of waters on or near roads.
